text: perfume genius hi everyone
you have to be Fantan oh here internets
busiest music nerd and it's time for a
review perfume genius put your back into
it
perfume genius is the singing
songwriting project of Mike had rias
this is his sophomore LP his debut album
came out in 2010 on Matador Records it
was titled learning and it received
quite a few great reviews but it was
just a few things about it that was
keeping it from really I guess
resonating with me the album has some
really pretty piano I felt like the
voice was there the personality was Lizz
Lizz there
the songs were there but the production
the recording just felt really lacking I
guess wasn't really doing much for me it
was low five but not in a really
flattering way I thought the cavernous
reverb that was inescapable with this
album really kept these songs just
feeling distant kind of alien which were
definitely feelings and emotions that
we're looking to be portrayed on that
album now with this new LP pianos mics
very unique voice which kind of sounds
like it's on the verge of weeping
literally and reverb are all still a
part of the foundation of perfume
geniuses music but most of the kinks on
learning are pretty much completely
ironed out and though this album does
have more going for it I think it's
greatest quality is the greatest quality
of learning as well and that's
simplicity you know on some of my
reviews I do get comments that are like
oh Anthony Fantana hates simplicity this
is too simple for Fantana and the thing
is that's not always the case of not an
enemy of simplicity on some albums less
is more
and I feel like that's the case here the
elements that build the songs
this LP are very simple and though there
is progression there is change on these
songs these alterations are usually very
quiet very subtle and very minimal and
that really works in this album's favor
especially considering that there are so
many feelings of loneliness and sadness
and introspection being pushed by these
songs the fact that you have mix that
just has so much space so much room to
think and feel and react it just
reinforces those feelings the
instrumentals on this LP just feel
really skeletal and musically the album
is is really simple to the chord
progressions on this LP travel through
really easy to play and kind of familiar
territory
there are moments on here like the track
sister song which is the last track on
here that borrows straight from an old
full chord progression the song hood
totally has a doo-wop thing going on
with its chord progression and that
track really takes advantage of that
sound of that style with the lyrics to
kind of going for this very
heartbreaking confessional angle and a
couple songs on here note ear being one
of them have a bit of a gospel spiritual
thing going on with the chords this
album is not filled with flair and and
mind blowing technical proficiency it's
very straightforward it's very simple
very quiet very raw very emotional and
I'd say visceral so not only are the
sounds on this LP pretty simple very
beautiful but played very gently on most
of these tracks as if they're afraid to
make noises if they're afraid to to be
bolder and be louder in fear of they
might lose their composure like they're
just trying to hold all these feelings
back there are a few spots on here where
the song sort of has this emotional
outburst
the floodgates really break open like on
the song hood which gets pretty loud
with some drums and piano breaks down
and gives this really passionate loud
vocal performance but most of the time
on this thing and the track note here is
an example this album is looking for
ways to just handle all of this
heartbreak all these really distraught
feelings just looking for a place to put
them or just a way to deal with them
that though it's a problem a lot of
people have had and that to me is where
this album kind of finds humanity finds
relatability now as far as the
production and the instrumentation goes
on this LP the recording is so much
better
Mike's voice now is right up front and
center you can make out all of his
lyrics for the most part and he does a
great job of just projecting his
emotions on to me whatever he's feeling
whatever social sort of idea or emotion
a song here is trying to portray I just
feel it instantly a lot of the time on
here I'm just kind of left speechless
and choked up by some of these songs and
what I find so funny about that is that
some of the tracks on here just so
freakin short one of the shortest on
here is just one minute 49 seconds and
Mike manages to pack a lot of song into
just a small sliver of time not to say
you get lots of sounds and lots of
melody in one single track but Mike sort
of builds these songs to be consumed in
a short amount of time the verses are
short of the choruses are shorter the
endings are very simple and on most of
these tracks despite the fact that they
are a little short of breath Mike always
make sure to pack into them an intro
kind of a build up a climax and a very
simple ending to me it's kind of like
thumbing through a book of just short
stories of musical vignettes or like of
poems it just ends up feeling really
passionate really emotional very
intimate - and I think a great deal that
is because of Mike's voice which
just has this insane vibrato to it not
even really a vibrato he sings really
well has some great range but as he is
delivering these vocals these lyrics he
just sounds like he's holding back tears
it sounds like he is shaking it's a
strange delivery not everybody is going
to like it but I do think this guy's
voice does have enough pitch to keep the
melodies going to keep me interested his
voice isn't too monie or to breathy and
the instruments the production on here
does a great job of carrying the
emotions along as well
and brings some nice variety between
these tracks too I love the really wery
low-pitched background vocals on the
song note tear it kind of sounds like
Mike took his own vocals and then just
brought them down a couple registers
like digitally I love the very airy
synth scape created in the background on
the track all waters the track hood is
is by comparison to the other tracks
pretty upbeat and pretty loud and has
some nice poppy piano chords and the
song 17 has these very kind of ominous
strings just lightly kissing the track
they do interject a few times but most
of the time they're just creating this
very soft but eerie texture in the
background it just adds to the tension
of the song the opening track on here
has a really nice noisy wall of sound
that kind of swallows the track up
toward its end and normal song is kind
of a change of pace just because of its
three-four timing and introduction of an
acoustic guitar vocal delivery
personality emotion songwriting and just
memorable hooks great production
I feel like this album is a triumph over
learning in almost every respect I
didn't come out of it with at least a
few gripes though there are some moments
on here that I think and a little bit
too abruptly for their own good
the track dirge on here is a little bit
too repetitive and the track floating
spit has a nice bed of synthesizers in
the background just like all waters but
the vocals are pulled backwards like
they were on learning just to be really
distant that track is a bit of a step
backwards stylistically whereas all
these other songs that are kind of
upfront and painful and bold and loud
and in-your-face just feel so good and
memorable and and hard-hitting and I
suppose another gripe that I could have
on here that I think other people may
have is the lyrics can lack some detail
from time to time I know that I and a
lot of people are into lyrics that
really tell a detailed story really get
into the Nitty Gritty of a situation and
though Mike does display a lot of
emotion and there are tracks on here
that lyrically I think give good reason
to be emotional especially hood which is
kind of about knowing something or
having done something that if your lover
knew about they would just not want to
have anything to do with you I'm sure
most people have a moment in their past
or a thought in their head that if
everyone knew things would just not be
the same and though the lyrics on hood
are simple they just paint that picture
perfectly I think the lyrics like the
rest of this LP do a lot with a little
but still you know it'd be nice to hear
some words on here that I guess are a
little less vague so I did love the hell
out of this album actually feeling a
strong eight to a light nine on this
it's definitely one of the better
releases I've heard this year and I'm
really happy to now kind of be
appreciating the music this project has
to offer but what did you guys think of
this thing did you love it did you hate
it why and what should I review next
Anthony Fantana perfume genius
